headline: Chocolate Ganache
description: Chocolate ganache made with bittersweet chocolate, rich heavy cream, and a touch of rum, adds high-end, bakery shop appeal to all of your homemade baked goods.

video.description: See how to make delicious homemade chocolate ganache.
video.name: Chocolate Ganache

name: Chocolate Ganache

recipeInstructions.text: Place chocolate in a medium mixing bowl.
Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring just to a boil, watching very carefully because if it boils for even a few seconds, it will boil out of the pot.
As soon as the cream comes to a boil, pour it over the chocolate in the mixing bowl. Whisk until chocolate has melted and mixture is smooth, then stir in rum.
To use ganache as a cake glaze, cool slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Start pouring glaze at the center of the cake and work outward.

For a fluffy frosting or chocolate filling, allow it to cool until thick (up to 1 hour in the refrigerator), and then whip until light and fluffy. Apply it with a spatula like a conventional frosting.

review.reviewBody: This is the easiest, most forgiving ganache recipe. If it starts to harden, just pop it in the microwave for a few seconds. Love it!
Was delicious
Worked perfectly
My chocolate broke up when I put the cream in, I need to figure out what I did wrong, it separated and didn’t end up with that pretty shine.

I used Ghiradeli bittersweet chocolate and the cream in proportions recommended. Added the rum. It was never liquidy. Came out thick and extremely bitter. Maybe next time I'll use semi-sweet as many here did. It did not pour as a glaze. Not sure what I could have done differently since it's a very straightforward recipe and directions so not sure why mine was such a failure.
Finally tried this recipe!! Easy and yummy!!

So easy!! I boiled the cream in the microwave and softened the chocolate in the microwave; then combined them and the rum. Not a fan of rum taste; next time I will omit, or use a liqueur (Cointreau?) instead.
Made the ganache to use as icing on a chocolate cake. It turned out to be delicious and my family loved it.

Easy and delicious. I can't I'm low-FODMAP so I can't have cream. I made it with a mix of almond and soy milk I had in the fridge. I added a little butter to make it richer (you can use Earth Balance if you can't have any dairy).

Super easy and rich. I whipped a small amount for the filling and then poured the rest on top. For whipping I used a hand mixer with a whisk attachment. I also heated the whipping cream up in the microwave instead of the stove, just got it steaming hot and the chocolate melted easily. Definitely will use again!

This was my first time making ganache and I’m in love! I only had 6oz of semi-sweet mini chocolate chips so I crossed my fingers and did the math and hoped it would work. I used 2/3 cup of heavy whipping cream. As soon as I saw the heavy cream come to a low boil I took the saucepan off the heat. I slowly poured it over the chocolate as I manually whipped up the ganache. It took very little manual effort. After a few moments I did it! It was the perfect mirror smooth ganache. I let it cool in the fridge for maybe 5-10mins and it was ready to pour over my cake. I had no idea ganache could be so easy to make! I will definitely make this again! This recipe is perfect.
So simple and delicious. Was worried about boiling cream but it was uneventful. I poured over cake which is 3 layer devils food cake with chocolate mousse for layers.
Was exactly as I wanted. Only I used 1/4 cup less cream to 300 grams semi sweet chocolate. Perfect for glazing my cookies.
Absolutely amazing! Only Ganache recipe I use. I use the Ghirardelli bittersweet chocolate when I make it for sure!
;my family liked the ganache. i didn't but thats because i dont like dark choc anyway. note for canadians: "heavy cream" is whipping cream
Myself and everyone I know loves this ganache. Definitely recommend!
Followed the directions exactly... this was spot on! Thanks for helping in my father in laws 90th birthday cake!

Amazing. It is extremely easy to make, and if you mess this up, well, I can't help you.
Use a whisk, if you don't have one, using a spoon or even a fork will do.
DO. NOT. USE. WHOLE. MILK. INSTEAD.
It won't give the same texture, but it kind of works. The fat is the reason why chocolate ganache comes together.
I like this recipe a lot. I added an extra teaspoon of rum for my taste. It turned out excellent. So many compliments.
This recipe is great. i made it for a zombie cake as the hair. i froze the ganache and it turned out great. i also refridgerated the extra as a glue for my cake and it turned out great
Excellent. This recipe is quick, easy, and beautiful on the cake. Thank you!

"Easy" doesn't even begin to describe this recipe! I made it even a little easier by buying a 10 oz bag of Ghirardelli bittersweet chocolate chips. No chopping for this girl! While I had the heavy cream on the stove heating up, I put the chips in a microwave safe bowl and heated them up for 30 seconds on high. I gave them a stir and put them back in for another 30 seconds. I took them out and added a little bit of rum like the recipe suggested and then added the cream. I whipped it with my whisk until smooth as directed and tucked it in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to chill so I could pour it over a cheesecake. Perfect!

Awesome recipe! I ended up using it as a ganache and a whipped mousse in the same cake! I used semisweet chocolate chips for this and it was enough to cover a 8" 2 layer cake. I cover the inside layer with cut up strawberries and ganache and whipped up the rest with a little bit of cream of tar tar to stabilize the cream for the frosting. Will be using this recipe for years to come!

I have made this before but never left a review. I kind of have to get a hang of it every time I make it as I feel it a bit too thick. I experimented with it and let a bit cool completely off then popped it in the microwave for about 5 seconds and added some of the cream, but straight out of the fridge....OMG! It was the right spreadable texture! I used it to finish a previously rough looking cupcake with with a layer of rough looking ganache. The cupcake came out so very shiny! I might use this as a trick to revive any leftover that cools off and thickens too much to be able to spread!

I don’t live in America and the cream used here doesn’t firm back up once you warm it. I recommend another technique that is foolproof: whip the cream with 2tsp cocoa powder, then drip in the melted chocolate, gently stir. This way it will be fluffy and firm. If you go ahead and melt the cream it will be too liquid to cover the cake (if you also don’t use American cream). I tried and it didn’t work even after freezing it. Makes fine ice cream tho.
Made a beautiful topping for cake!
Made a beautiful topping for cake!
Heavenly!!
The ganache was delicious and the recipe was super simple and quick. I wanted a thicker ganache so i used the chocolate and cream in a 2:1 ratio. That worked out pretty well.

Delicious! I didn't have any rum on hand, so I just omitted it.
I made two recipes one with Bakers brand chocolate baking bars with 56% Cacao and the other with Toll house semi-sweet Chocolate morsels.
Just for taste testing purposes.
The results... the Bakers ganache was slightly more tart in flavor. And the Tollhouse Ganache was a little sweeter. I feel that the rum will enhance the flavor of both. So I will reheat small portions of each ganache and add the rum to give you a more accurate test. I will return to complete my findings. Bye for now!!

Always use this recipe on my chocolate cake (minus the rum). For a two layer 9-in cake, this is perfect. I like to whip it and it really goes a long way. For the chocolate, I just use a bag of semi-sweet chocolate chips. Highly recommend!
Very easy if you are cooking challenged like me. It turned out great and was a wonderful topping for a chocolate cake I made.
Super easy to make and delicious. Used semisweet chocolate chips.

This was so simple to make. I’d never made a ganache before and this recipe helped me nail it! I made it for my daughter’s birthday cake. Chocolate is her favorite thing on earth and she loved it, as well as all of the guests. I’ll make this again for sure!

I am classically trained pastry chef and a 1984 Graduate of Johnson and Wales University. I have made 1000's of ganache tortes and this recipe is simple enough for the beginner. For the person who was disappointed because they wanted the ganache for chocolate covered strawberry's if you make this version and the strawberry are washed, dried and cold it will harden and still be delicious. You can make this recipe and it will last weeks. Just warm it when your ready to use and stir with clean whisk or spoon. This ganache recipe also makes a great chocolate truffle base.

Perfect, quick, and easy. One tip: heat the cream in the microwave in 30 second intervals, stirring in between. When it starts to boil up, quickly hit cancel or just open the door to stop. Pour over chocolate, stir and it's done. Thanks!

So rich, delicious and easy! A few tips: (1) you need to weigh out your chocolate chips on a scale - using the 8 oz = 1 cup rule doesn't work for solids; (2) after you add the boiling cream to the bowl of chocolate, put a lid on top and wait 5 minutes; this provides sufficient time for the cream to actually begin to melt the chocolate without losing heat; and (3) wait about 5-10 minutes for the ganache to cool and thicken slightly before pouring on a cake. You probably could wait 15 minutes.

I used this ganache for a 3 layer chocolate cake and it looks beautiful. I used high-quality (i.e., not Nestle) chocolate chips and didn't chop them at all beforehand. Very easy and straightforward, and the taste is heavenly.
Excellent results and since this was my first try at ganache I’m extremely happy with how this turned out!
Super foolproof yummy. I used it for a death by Chocolate cupcake.

What is there to say? This is about all there is to ganache. Chocolate, heavy cream and maybe a dash of rum. Easy peasy and so very versatile. Want it thinner? Add a bit more cream. Thicker, a bit less cream. You can serve it warm, cool or whipped into a heavenly frosting. Just remember to chop up your chocolate (even if using chocolate chips - it will melt faster and blend smoother). And if it is cooling before it is all blended after adding your hot cream, just pop in the microwave at half power for a few seconds to rewarm and whisk again until melted and smooth. Oh, and you can choose your chocolate too. Forget the chocolate snobs who say dark, decadent, bitter chocolate only. Yes, that makes a delicious ganache, but depending on your need/tastes, so will semi-sweet and even milk chocolate. You choose and enjoy! :)
First one I’ve ever made and it was perfect! WOW!
To recipe add vanilla extract or vanilla paste and some marshmallow cream.
Easy breezy and quick. I added 1.5 TBS Khalua and 1 TBS instant espresso coffee, the Grenache was the delicious center for the French Macarons.
Easy and delicious! Highly recommend if you like dark chocolate.
Excellent and easy as ganache or whipped cream , just be sure your cake is very cool - especially layer cakes. His exceptionally well with raspberry jam/spread in layer cake.

Place the bowl in the refrigerator 30-40 minutes to speed cool. To whip, stir, scraping the bowl to bring the coldest ganache to the center and even out the chill. Whisk by hand, or pour into chilled mixer bowl & whisk until thickened and fluffy with whisk attachment. Frosts and fills 2 layers, 8 or 9 inches.

Super easy and versatile! I used dark chocolate chips and used it as a poured glaze over a chocolate mousse cake in a springform pan, dipped filled cupcake tops in it and whipped it to make a mile high sweet pipe-able cupcake frosting! YUM!
I used two parts chocolate to one part cream. I like a thicker ganache for frosting cakes. Easy to make.

Beautifully rich. I don't know if I made it wrong or something, but I left my ganache covered cake in the fridge overnight and the next morning the ganache had set.

But I loved the ease of making it and the flavour, so I will definitely be making it again.
Delicious will def make again, easy too :)
Simple and delicious
Super easy and sooooo good. Followed the recipe but added whiskey instead of rum for the 2nd batch and they taste amazing. My new favorite recipe!
My cake roll broke when unrolling to fill.

If you want as much as shown in the picture, double or triple the recipe. But I did make several changes. I added 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 cup corn syrup to stabilize it. If I hadn't added those two things, room temperature would have melted it and without the powdered sugar and corn syrup it wouldn't have been sweet at all.

It came out really well. If you want to make it a fluffy frosting, and it’s not becoming fluffy when you whip it, stick it in the freezer for a few minutes and do it again. It will come out nice and fluffy. It is VERY rich and chocolate, so if you’re like me, and prefer milk chocolate over dark chocolate, I would get a milk chocolate baking bar instead of dark chocolate. This is a really easy and wonderful recipe!!!
Easy to make and tastes great. i whipped it to use as frosting for a German Chocolate cake. My family loved it!
Love this so easy. I used kahlua since my cake filling was Bavarian creme. So yummy

First time making and the video looking super simple - how could I mess up. Followed directions exactly. Not knowing what to expect I "Allow[ed] the ganache to cool slightly before pouring over a cake." The ganache in a matter a seconds was as thick as pudding. My opinion that if you want to "pour" over your cake don't wait...just do it ASAP. Maybe more cream is necessary. I'll know next time to whisk and pour. This was for a neighbor's birthday party so don't know how it taste (but I'm sue it will taste wonderful).
So easy and yummy too! Brought the cream just to boil and didn't really let it cool but just a minute or so. It poured perfectly over my cake. Definitely a keeper recipe!
So easy and delicious!
I used 1 1/2 cups of semi sweet chocolate chips. After making I let it sit for about 15 minutes then poured it over a boston cream pie. Very yummy & a nice texture!

I halved the recipe and hand beat it to keep it smooth. I poured it on top of my cheesecake while the spring form was still intact so it didn't drip down the sides. When it was set it made a lovely layer of the richest chocolate! It definitely stood up to the cheesecake and wasn't lost in the flavor. Highly recommend!
It is very delicious and so easy to make.
Super easy! I put the cream in the microwave for about 2 minutes until it was boiling and then stirred in the chocolate. I used chocolate chips...FYI, about 1 1/2 cup is 9 ounces. Came out perfect!
I used the "cling wrap" method in order to contain the exact consistency! You could try it too and see the difference.
This was so easy and perfect! I used a 10 oz bag of mini dark chocolate chips and omitted the rum. I will definitely be experimenting with different types of good chocolate and flavored liqueurs.
Great recipe! Used this atop pastries. The bittersweet chocolate was perfect with the creme pat inside the pastry.

This was so easy to make, and very creamy and delicious. I added another tablespoon of cream instead of the rum. I wanted to whip it, so I cooled it in the refrigerator. It was in there too long, and set up on me, so I added another touch of cream and whipped it anyway. Turned out perfect! I used chocolate chips. Next time, I will use the full 12 oz package and increase the cream by 1/3 cup, so that I will have more!

I made this to drizzle over a dark chocolate cake. It's a winner!! It was the easiest thing in the world to make and came out delicious. I served the cake not long after making and drizzling the ganache so it was still liquidy and I loved it. I put the cake in the fridge overnight so the ganache hardened into a soft shell and again -- I loved it!!! It's delicious fresh or chilled. I will say I didn't have quite 9 oz of chocolate -- I bought two 4 oz bars and didn't want to buy another bar just for one more ounce. And by the time I got done "testing" the chocolate, there may have only been 7 oz left. It still came out just wonderfully. I can't remember the exact percentage of the chocolate I bought -- it was somewhere in the range of 60-63%. I am SO excited about making this ganache again in the future.
This was quick and easy. I used it to glaze a cheesecake and it turned out phenomenal. This is my new go to.
Turned out perfect! Followed the recipe to a T!
Loved it on yellow cake. Letting it cool to Very much room temperature did allow me to spread it without it being too thin. Kids loved it too!

Substituted 1 1/2 cups of semi-sweet chocolate chips, omitted the rum, but this was DELICIOUS! Let cool and whipped it to make a frosting. I will never buy canned frosting again! So easy to make! Love it!
Delicious!
LOVE this ganache! Easy & decadent.
I used semi sweet minis omitted rum.
I've made this recipe several times. I use Bourbon instead of rum for a richer flavor. It's a family favorite and requested often!

I am yet to find a recipe that I enjoy more. Every time I make it it is a total hit with everyone. Made a dark chocolate ganache and used the Bundt pan and I’m sure it’s going to be as good as the other eight or 10 I’ve made before. Thanks for the great recipe!
This worked with almond milk and 85% chocolate (lactose intolerance). I did add some maple sugar and honey to sweeten it up a bit and it was fantastic! Thank you!
This is a standard truffle recipe. Any chocolate would work. I added a couple tablespoons of butter.

My goodness! What have I been missing all these years! This is so easy, it's practically fool-proof. I poured it over a peppermint frosted chocolate cake and voila'! The cake disappeared! I had to make it without the rum and it was awesome, next time trying rum or another flavoring.
Perfecto, Quick , easy and simple.....

I made this as a topping over a chocolate mousse cake.
I used spiced rum and also a Tbs of iced coffee. It was my first time trying such an elaborate topping and it turned out great. 

I couldn't find anything labeled "Bittersweet" chocolate at my store, but the they did have "unsweet" (100% Cacao) "Semi-sweet" (~56% Cacao) and "German Sweet" (~44% Cacao)... they were 4oz bars, so I did a bar of semi a bar of german and filled the last oz with the unsweet... it was great that way.

Big Tip:
Be sure to place the cake on a piece of parchment paper when you do the pour over so that you can scoop the gnache back up on the bare spots and make a thicker layer on top as it cools.
Perfect! I put Oreo crumbs in at the end for my cupcakes.
This ganache was simple and AMAZING. I followed directions exactly and it came out WONDERFUL. Will use again.

Easy and delicious. I did hand chop into small pieces 8 oz 60% bittersweet and 1 oz dark chocolate. Heated cream poured over the chopped chocolate it was delicious and beautiful definitely will do again
Easy & good. Use good chocolate!

A. MAY. ZING! I make this ganache for a chocolate ring cake and then drizzle it across the cake, back and forth, in a clockwise manner. It presents beautifully and tastes like something from a top bakery! I also place strips of parchment paper under the bottom of the cake before drizzling the ganache and remove them when finished pouring. The plate stays perfectly clean!

This is the perfect chocolate icing! I couldnt find bittersweet chocolate anywhere and found this substitute: 9oz of semi-sweet chocolate plus 2 1/4 tsp unsweetened cocoa. Worked like a charm. I poured enough over my cake to cover and then let the rest cool down and whipped it into icing. Its amazing as whipped icing!

I made this last year while doing Christmas cookies. I wanted something to dip Scottish shortbread fingers into, and this worked perfectly, and everyone just loved it! It was positively decadent, so of course, I'm going to do it again this year!

This was easy & turned out great! I added the chocolate ganache to the top of the Too Much Chocolate Cake. I mixed a half batch of the ganache recipe and it was the perfect amount, I thought. This ganache was suggested after the cake video played. Thank you for sharing the ganache recipe. In the future, I will make this instead of chocolate buttercream.

When I make Too Much Chocolate Cake as cupcakes, i make a full batch of this ganache recipe.
Extremely simple and easy to make. And just overall completely tasty!

this is my go-to recipe now.
always great and so easy

So easy and delicious! I let mine cool longer, and whipped it into icing! It was a Dark Chocolate Heaven!! Easier by far than homemade butter cream. I smoothed it over a new recipe I was trying, called Whacky Cake! Both were easy, and awesome! :)

Can't believe that such an easy quick recipe is so luxurious and decadently delicious! A chocolate lover's dream... Whether you add rum or amaretto liquor as I did, this recipe is a fail proof hit! I've poured this velvety ganache over chocolate cake, cheesecake, and my new favourite, the Allrecipes 'Best Brownies' recipe from this site!! Have to stop myself from pouring it over everything...
made it exactly as written, easy and delicious , will make again.

I dont know How this gets such high reviews. Its disgusting. I used Ghirardelli bittersweet chips and its Awful. Its Dripping oil, that once cool is just solidified fat hanging from the cake. and its..Bitter..surprise, right? I feel like an idiot for following it. It just Ruined my Black Magic cake. Use the Mocha Icing recipe.

I made it according to the recipe w/o the rum but the butter/oil in the chocolate separated. It came to the top so much I could pour it off. I used ghiradelli 60% cacoa. I was going to pour over a ice cream cake I’d made but the ganache didn’t turn out like I’d anticipated. Anyone have any idea why?
